reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the Chateau as a stop-over on our way down from Cherbourg to Bordeaux. It was very easy to find from the main D road - well sign-posted. Our welcome was warm and we were shown to the Canelle room which was a comfortable room with lovely views and a big bathroom. The floors were very creaky but luckily there was no one below us!
reviews.title: Excellent place to stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We opted to eat at the Chateau and were glad we did. We had a delcious 4-course meal including wine. A very peaceful night's sleep ensued. We did not stay for breakfast so cannot comment on that but all in all a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Peaceful charming place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed with our 2 Irish terriers on the way back to Roscoff to catch a ferry. We had the lavender room, and loved it. Lots of grounds, some eccentricities but we were delighted with the whole experience. It is not expensive, the dinner and breakfast were both substantial and good value.
reviews.title: I wanted to take my bedroom home with me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Vanille room. We slept in a superb room overlooking a vast meadow with beautiful trees and a juliette balcony. The room was vast, beautifully furnished and an amazing King sized bed. I would be happy to stay here with my grandchildren as they would have loved the park, the gardens and the two rather stand-offish camels.
reviews.title: french chateax and park garden
